events.name: Duo-Keynotes: Kaleido (Business Cloud) and MediLOT (Electronic Health Records)
events.description: About the projects:1) Kaleido, a ConsenSys business based in Raleigh, North Carolina, is the Blockchain Business Cloud. Itâ€™s an all-in-one enterprise SaaS platform that radically simplifies the creation and operation of private blockchain networks. Kaleido recently exited stealth mode and announced its platform at Consensus 2018, along with its partnership with Amazon Web Services (check out the news here: https://www.cnbc.com/2018/05/15/amazon-is-moving-into-blockchain-with-a-new-partnership.html and the launch video: https://youtu.be/4eyIaimhwK0). Learn how to leverage Kaleido to accelerate your journey going from concept to blockchain consortium in minutes. Check us out at kaledio.io. 2) MediLOT is a health data protocol that aims to solve the concerns of Electronic Health Records (EHR). Current EHR systems are fragmented, centralised and lack patient ownership. Through a dual blockchain solution, MediLOT incorporates Artificial Intelligence capabilities onboard its control and data layers which allows the equitable sharing of health data. The MediLOT ecosystem will consist of patients, healthcare providers, researchers and commercial companies.Check out www.medilot.com About the speakers:1) Sophia Lopez is a founder of Kaleido, a Consensys Enterprise Business. Sophia began working with blockchain in 2015 helping shape the community and develop new commercial approaches to meet unique enterprise demands. Prior to Consensys, Sophia led an enterprise blockchain product portfolio with responsibility to drive the business by developing high-value offerings to help clients achieve better business outcomes through adoption of blockchain technology. Sophia has held various positions in large enterprises where she has shaped business vision and strategy for various software, hardware and services portfolios, developed creative solutions to complex technology problems, and achieved strong business results as a Profit and Loss (P&L) Leader with responsibility for multi-billion dollar lines of business. Sophia has an engineering degree from Harvard University and an MBA from University of North Carolina Chapel Hill. 2) Dr Ngiam is the Co Founder of MediLOT and the Group Chief Technology Officer of NUHS. An endocrine surgeon by training, Dr Ngiam was awarded the ExxonMobil-NUS Research Fellowship for Clinicians in 2007 and oversees most of the AI and machine learning initiatives within the Group.
events.location: Paypal Innovation Lab, 5 Temasek Boulevard #07-01, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore, 038985
